title: Understanding Gibbs Free Energy Change
text: The Gibbs free energy change for a process is given by the formula: ΔG $$=$$ ΔH - TΔS .

title: Values Given in the Problem
text:
You know the following:
- ΔH $$=$$ $$40.67$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
- ΔS $$=$$ $$109.3$$ $$ rac{J}{K} mol$$.
- Temperature, T $$=$$ $$350$$ K and you need to calculate ΔG for $$2.50$$ mol of water.

title: Make the Units Consistent
text: Convert the units of ΔH from kJ to J to match ΔS .\nΔH $$=$$ $$40.67$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ $$=$$ $$40670$$ $$\frac{J}{mol}$$.

title: Calculate ΔG for $$1$$ mol of Water
text: Substitute the values into the Gibbs energy formula:ΔG $$=$$ $$40670$$ - $$350\times109.3$$ .

title: Calculate ΔG for $$2.50$$ mol of Water
text: You have calculated ΔG for $$1$$ mol. Now, multiply by $$2.50$$ to find the ΔG for $$2.50$$ mol of water.

title: Final Calculation for ΔG of $$2.50$$ mol
